member.name: IAttachmentExecute.CheckPolicy
member.summary: Provides a Boolean test that can be used to make decisions based on the attachment's execution policy.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.ClearClientState
member.summary: Removes any stored state that is based on the client's GUID. An example might be a setting based on a checked box that indicates a prompt should not be displayed again for a particular file type.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.Execute
member.summary: Executes an action on an attachment.
member.param: The handle of the parent window.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains a verb specifying the action to be performed on the file. See the lpOperation parameter in for valid strings. This value can be NULL.
A pointer to a handle to the source process, used for synchronous operation. This value can be NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.Prompt
member.summary: Presents a prompt UI to the user.
member.param: A handle to the parent window.
A member of the enumeration that indicates what type of prompt UI to display to the user.
A member of the enumeration that indicates the action to be performed upon user confirmation.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.Save
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SaveWithUI
member.summary: Presents the user with explanatory error UI if the save action fails.
member.param: The handle of the parent window.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetClientGuid
member.summary: Specifies and stores the GUID for the client.
member.param: The GUID that represents the client.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetClientTitle
member.summary: Specifies and stores the title of the prompt window.
member.param: A pointer to a string that contains the title text.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetFileName
member.summary: Specifies and stores the proposed name of the file.
member.param: A pointer to a string that contains the file name.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code, including the following.

listheader.description: The pszFileName value is is set to NULL, points to an empty string, or points to a file name longer than MAX_PATH.
The file name cannot be stored.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetLocalPath
member.summary: Sets and stores the path to the file.
member.param: A pointer to a string that contains the local path where the attachment file is to be stored.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetReferrer
member.summary: Sets the security zone associated with the attachment file based on the referring file.
member.param: A pointer to a string containing the path of the referring file.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute.SetSource
member.summary: Sets an alternate path or URL for the source of a file transfer.
member.param: A pointer to a string containing the path or URL to use as the source.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAttachmentExecute
member.summary: Exposes methods that work with client applications to present a user environment that provides safe download and exchange of files through email and messaging attachments.
